question: When is the gamma ray emitted?
option1: When a nucleus in a ground state goes to the excited state
option2: When a nucleus in an excited state spontaneously decays to its ground state
option3: When alpha rays and beta rays collide
answer: When a nucleus in an excited state spontaneously decays to its ground state
explanation: When a nucleus in an excited state spontaneously decays to its ground state (or to a lower energy state), a photon is emitted with energy equal to the difference in the two energy levels of the nucleus. This is the so-called gamma decay.
